Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a light-brown pottery vessel, the interior is covered with a brown resinous substance, worn smooth and chipped away in places, the exterior is covered with a self-slip and remains of one line of Coptic text written in black ink, now smudged.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393251) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393251)
